title: Scenario 1: Basic Creation & Cross-Tab Sync
details:
Issue #47 Scenario 1: Basic Quick Tab Creation and Cross-Tab State Persistence

**Purpose:** Verify that Quick Tabs are created correctly, persist across different browser tabs, and maintain consistent position/size state globally.

**Test Location:** tests/extension/issue-47-scenarios.spec.js

**Key Test Steps:**
1. Create Quick Tab on first page
2. Verify Quick Tab appears on first page
3. Open second browser tab
4. Verify Quick Tab automatically appears on second tab with same ID
5. Verify position/size syncs across tabs

**Test Bridge Methods Used:**
- createQuickTab(url, options)
- getQuickTabs()
- waitForQuickTabCount(expectedCount, timeout)
- clearAllQuickTabs()

**Expected Behavior:**
- Quick Tab created with unique ID
- Cross-tab sync latency < 100ms via BroadcastChannel
- Same Quick Tab ID and URL in both tabs
- Position and size maintained globally

**Implementation Status:** âœ… Implemented and tested

**Test Pattern:**
```javascript
const helper1 = new ExtensionTestHelper(page1);
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://github.com');
const tabs1 = await helper1.getQuickTabs();
const quickTabId = tabs1[0].id;

const helper2 = new ExtensionTestHelper(page2);
await helper2.waitForQuickTabCount(1, 5000);
const tabs2 = await helper2.getQuickTabs();
expect(tabs2[0].id).toBe(quickTabId);
```

**Dependencies:** BroadcastChannel API, browser.storage.local
